text: We will focus on stocks in this video.
We'll show you how to get started

and then how to find, buy,
track, and sell stocks.

This video is about how
to use the Robinhood app,
not how to invest.

What you decide to do with
your money is up to you.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
After downloading the Robinhood app
and linking your bank account,

on the home screen, press
the magnifying glass
to search for a stock.
We're going to search for Google.
At the top, under "Browse,"
we're going to type in "Google."
Press here, and it'll take you to a screen

where you can see the
statistics of the stock,

ranging from a one-day
to a five-year time span.
Scroll to the bottom of the page
to find news on the stock or the company.
Below this are analyst ratings,

where you can find out
what different analysts
are saying about the stock.
If you go back to the search menu,

you can choose the
different categories here

to find out what the most popular
stocks are in each sector.

You can also buy
cryptocurrencies using Robinhood.

Press the icon that
looks like a person here
to go to your account.
Click on "Transfers"
and then "Transfer to Robinhood."
Set the amount you want to transfer in,

press "Review," and then
"Submit" if you're happy.
Press "Continue,"
and then "Done."

Go to the page of the
stock you wish to purchase,

press the green trade
button, and then "Buy."
Choose to buy in dollars or in shares
by pressing this button here.
We're going to buy in dollars.

Input the amount you want
to buy and press "Review."

The amount of shares your
dollar value amounts to
will be written here.
You can then swipe up to submit.
You can go to your portfolio

by pressing the graph
icon at the bottom here.
Your investments will be shown here.
Choose the stock you want to track,
and it'll show you its performance here.

It will show you the performance
in a variety of time spans,

including how much your
stock has risen or declined
since your investment.

Go to your portfolio by
pressing the graph icon.
Click on the stock you want to sell,
press "Trade," and then "Sell."

You can either choose to
trade in stocks or in dollars.
Input your amount, then hit "Review."
To withdraw your money,
press the icon that looks like a person,

then press "Transfers" and
"Transfer to Your Bank."
